main event: A whitish-yellow object with a reddish casing was observed for 2 hours in the sky over Boothbay Harbor, Maine on September 21, 1968.
interesting points: The object appeared to be stationary in the sky and did not move, but the witness saw it move in various directions.
The object was observed to be brighter than the brightest stars, but not as bright as the Sun.
The object did not make any sound and had clearly defined edges.
The witness compared the object's size to a match stick held at arm's length, covering all but one corner.
The witness drew a sketch of the object showing a roughly circular shape with a tail or vapor trail.
sighted object: a whitish-yellow object with a reddish casing
